intro: Horkelia californica var. elata, commonly known as the slender horkelia, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats, such as grasslands and slopes. It has narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. This variety is often found in the coastal ranges and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
